title: 5 Context Levels for Better AI Prompting in 2025
content:
# 5 Context Levels for Better AI Prompting in 2025

What if you could get better results from AI with a simple prompt than with a complex one? The reality is, you can‚Äîbecause getting the most out of AI in 2025 is no longer about better prompting. The secret lies in giving it better **context**.

But what does that actually mean? And how can you use it to transform your AI from a forgetful assistant into your most valuable team member?

Let‚Äôs start with the foundation.

---

## Level 1: Training Data ‚Äî The AI‚Äôs ‚ÄúBusiness Degree‚Äù

Every large language model (LLM) you interact with has read billions‚Äîeven trillions‚Äîof documents. It has what amounts to a business degree. It knows *some* things about business. But it knows *nothing* about *you*.

Here‚Äôs a quick demonstration:

> ‚ÄúGive me a marketing strategy for our flagship product.‚Äù

The AI charges ahead and delivers what looks like a well-thought-out, comprehensive strategy. But it‚Äôs not. It doesn‚Äôt know your audience segments. It‚Äôs guessing‚Äîand often guessing wrong.

For example, it might suggest SEO or partnerships when your business doesn‚Äôt use them. It might target consultants when your real audience is business owners. The response is generic, invented, and ultimately useless.

Why? Because it‚Äôs based solely on **Level 1 context**: the model‚Äôs training data.

Many people obsess over using the latest, most advanced model‚Äîthe one with more trillions of parameters. But that‚Äôs missing the point. What matters now isn‚Äôt the size or sophistication of the model. It‚Äôs **how much context you give it**.

---

## Level 2: The System Prompt ‚Äî The Hidden 120-Page Rulebook

Did you know there‚Äôs a 120-page document controlling and shaping every response an LLM gives you? Most people don‚Äôt. This is the **system prompt**‚Äîa hidden set of instructions created by the companies that build these models.

You can‚Äôt edit the system prompt, but you *can* exploit it.

For instance, Claude has seven trigger words that force the model into deeper analysis and thinking. Using one‚Äîor better yet, several‚Äîof these words can yield a **10x improvement** in response quality, with no additional context.

Try this:

> ‚ÄúGive me an **in-depth, comprehensive** marketing strategy for our flagship product.‚Äù

Just adding those two or three words transforms the output. The AI now considers market size, growth trends, competitive landscape, and core positioning. It‚Äôs deeper, more thoughtful, and genuinely strategic‚Äînot just longer.

This is Level 2 context in action.

> üí° Pro tip: I‚Äôve compiled a breakdown of hidden system prompts for Claude and GPT-5, including trigger words and design principles. Check the description for a link.

---

## Level 3: User Preferences ‚Äî Tell the AI How You Like to Communicate

This is the first level where *you* take control.

You can tell the LLM how you want it to communicate with you‚Äîand these preferences apply across every chat, every time.

For example, in Claude, you can set **personal preferences** like:

- Answer in bullet points and sub-bullet points
- Be conservative in your thinking
- Tell me your level of certainty

Once saved, these preferences shape all future interactions. In ChatGPT, the same feature is called **Custom Instructions**.

The result? More useful, personalized, and reliable responses‚Äîwithout having to repeat yourself.

---

## Level 4: Project Knowledge ‚Äî Your AI‚Äôs ‚ÄúBrain‚Äù

This is the most transformative‚Äîand most underused‚Äîlayer of context.

Imagine your AI doesn‚Äôt just know *business*‚Äîit knows *your* business.

Let‚Äôs go back to our marketing strategy prompt, but this time with **project knowledge** enabled:

> ‚ÄúGive me a marketing strategy for our flagship product.‚Äù

Now, the AI knows:

- The name and abbreviation of your product
- That you‚Äôre in ‚ÄúCohort 2‚Äù
- Your target audience: businesses with 10‚Äì50 employees
- That you work with digital agencies and professional services firms
- Testimonials from past participants
- Your content platforms: email newsletter and LinkedIn
- Your event sign-up tool (e.g., Luma)
- Your sales channels and competitors

This isn‚Äôt guesswork. This is specific, accurate, and deeply informed.

### How It Works

In apps like Whisper Flow or Claude, you can create **projects**‚Äîdedicated workspaces for specific initiatives. Upload files: customer testimonials, strategy docs, positioning statements, applications, pain points‚Äîanything relevant.

Every conversation within that project automatically draws from these files. You‚Äôre no longer talking to an intern on their first day. You‚Äôre collaborating with a **fully onboarded, highly experienced team member**.

---

## Level 5: The Prompt ‚Äî Where Everything Comes Together

You‚Äôve built four layers of permanent context. Now comes the moment of truth: your actual prompt.

But you don‚Äôt need a library of pre-written, complex prompts. You can have the AI **help you write the prompt itself**.

Example:

> ‚ÄúHelp me create a new prompt that will generate a comprehensive, in-depth marketing strategy for Cohort 3 of Second Brain Enterprise (October 2025). Include analysis of past complaints and wins, team assignments and OKRs, and 10 YouTube video ideas tied to our persona and benefits.‚Äù

The AI draws from project knowledge, structures the request, and produces a highly detailed prompt‚Äîwhich you can then use to generate the full strategy.

The result? A response that includes:

- Differentiators and proof points
- YouTube video ideas with direct relevance
- Case study templates
- Email nurture sequences
- Sales enablement materials
- ROI frameworks
- Team assignments and OKRs

What would take a human weeks to compile, the AI delivers in minutes.

---

## Your Roadmap to Context Mastery

Here‚Äôs how to implement these five layers in less than a week:

1. **Today**: Google ‚Äú[Your AI] + system prompt‚Äù to find trigger words and hidden features.
2. **Tomorrow morning**: Add 3+ user preferences (e.g., communication style, certainty level).
3. **By the end of the week**: Create one project and upload your current work files‚Äîstrategy docs, customer feedback, anything relevant.

That‚Äôs it. Three actions. Then watch your one-sentence prompts outperform what used to require an essay.

---

## Final Thought

Context engineering doesn‚Äôt make prompt engineering obsolete‚Äîit makes it **more powerful**. When you preload the right context, even simple prompts become incredibly effective.

We‚Äôre moving into an era where the value of AI isn‚Äôt in the model‚Äîit‚Äôs in how well you teach it about *you*.
